dispatch(request, *args, **kwargs)

.dispatch() is pretty much the same as Django’s regular dispatch, but with extra hooks for startup, finalize, and exception handling.

class api.views.UserViewSet(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: ModelViewSet

authentication_classes = [<class 'rest_framework.authentication.SessionAuthentication'>]
dispatch(request, *args, **kwargs)

.dispatch() is pretty much the same as Django’s regular dispatch, but with extra hooks for startup, finalize, and exception handling.

get_permissions()[source]

Override get_permissions to only return IsAuthenticated for list and retrieve actions and IsAuthenticated and IsAdminUser for other actions.

get_queryset()[source]

Override get_queryset to only return all users if the current user is staff

Otherwise, return an empty queryset.

permission_classes = [<class 'rest_framework.permissions.IsAuthenticated'>]
queryset
serializer_class

alias of UserSerializer

API Tests

class api.tests.test_categories_api.CategoryViewSetTest(methodName='runTest')[source]

Bases: TestCase

setUp()[source]

Set up a test client and create a category

test_create_category()[source]

Test that a POST to the category list endpoint with valid data creates a new category

test_delete_category()[source]

Test that a DELETE to the category detail endpoint deletes a category

This test deletes the single category that was created in the setUp method. After the deletion, the category count is expected to be zero.

test_get_categories()[source]

Test that a GET to the category list endpoint returns a 200 status

test_update_category()[source]

Test that a PUT to the category detail endpoint with valid data updates a category

class api.tests.test_products_api.ProductViewSetTest(methodName='runTest')[source]

Bases: TestCase

Set up a test client and create a category

test_create_product()[source]

Test that a POST to the product list endpoint with valid data creates a new product

test_delete_product()[source]

Test that a DELETE to the product detail endpoint deletes a product

test_get_products()[source]

Test that a GET to the product list endpoint returns a 200 status

class api.tests.test_orders_api.OrderViewSetTest(methodName='runTest')[source]

Bases: TestCase

setUp()[source]

Set up a test client and create a test user and an order for the user

The test client is set up with the test user authenticated, and the test user has a single order with the given details.

test_create_order()[source]

Test that a POST to the order list endpoint with valid data creates a new order

test_delete_order()[source]

Test that a DELETE to the order detail endpoint deletes an order

This test deletes the single order that was created in the setUp method. After the deletion, the order count is expected to be zero.

test_get_orders()[source]

Test that a GET to the order list endpoint returns a 200 status and a list of orders for the authenticated user

The list of orders is expected to contain a single order, with the id of the order that was created in the setUp method.

test_update_order()[source]

Test that a PUT to the order detail endpoint with valid data updates an order

class api.tests.test_users_api.UserViewSetTest(methodName='runTest')[source]

Bases: TestCase

setUp()[source]

Set up a test user and an admin user, and log in as the test user

test_create_user_admin_only()[source]

Test that only an admin user can create a new user

test_create_user_non_admin()[source]

Test that a non admin user can not create a new user

test_delete_user_admin_only()[source]

Test that only an admin user can delete a user

test_delete_user_non_admin()[source]

Test that a non admin user can not delete a user

test_list_users_authenticated()[source]

Test that a user can list all users if they are authenticated

test_list_users_unauthenticated()[source]

Test that a user can not list all users if they are not authenticated

test_retrieve_user_authenticated()[source]

Test that an admin user can retrieve the details of any user if they are authenticated

test_retrieve_user_unauthenticated()[source]

Test that a user can not retrieve the details of any user if they are not authenticated

test_update_user_admin_only()[source]

Test that only an admin user can update a user

test_update_user_non_admin()[source]

Test that a non admin user can not update a user
